description: Trade Agreement: NONE,Tendering Procedures: Suppliers on permanent list or able to meet qualification requirements,Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest/Lower Bid,Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: Yes,Nature of Requirements: ...,Transport Canada has a requirement for the disposal of a barge in Peel River,...
full_summary:
### Tender Notice for Disposal of Barge in Peel River

### Solicitation Number: T5013-230002

#### Issued Date: 2023-05-19
#### Closing Date: 2023-06-16T02:59:00

### Notice Type: Request for Proposal
### Procurement Method: Competitive Selective Tendering
### Selection Criteria: Lowest Price

The Public Works and Government Services Canada invites suppliers to submit proposals for the disposal of a barge in Peel River. The requirement is situated in the Northwest Territories, Canada.

### Procurement Details

*   The barge shall be removed from its current location by March 31, 2024.
*   The completion of work and deliverables must be completed by March 31, 2024.
*   An Indigenous participation plan is required with the bid.
*   Only suppliers holding a Supply Arrangement (SA) under the Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) EVC01-202004/A are eligible to participate in this bid solicitation.

### Debriefing

Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation within 15 working days from receipt of notification that their bid was unsuccessful. The debriefing may be provided in writing or by telephone.

### Contact Information

For any inquiries or submission of bids, please contact:

Shaheed Ratanshi
TEL: (873) 353-2506
Email: shaheed.ratanshi@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
Address: Place du Portage, Phase III, Tower c, 11 Laurier Street, 6C2, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A0S5

### Notice Documents

Refer to the attached notice documents for more information on this procurement opportunity.
Note : The notice documents are attached to this tender in the format of PDF files.

### Communication

Correspondence, including requests for debriefing, must be submitted in either English or French. It is recommended to contact the contracting authority in advance to confirm the applicable language.

Please note that this procurement opportunity was advertised on the CanadaBuys website. Books
